channel.title: Tools on PR
channel.description: Recent content in Tools on PR

item.title: Kids these days
item.description: Last weekend I was fortunate to be a technical evaluator of an hackathon. Yes, I’m trying to be vague here, as my company sponsored this event at a most reputed university of our state, this post is just my view.

item.title: Book Recommendation: Testing with coffeescript by Jack Franklin [Free ebook]
item.description: TDD (Test Driven Development) was introduced to me around 2006 with PHPUnit. As a naive, I couldn’t see the benefits, eg.

item.title: Project Plan and Gantter.com
item.description: Project planning is always a difficult task for me. I could do anything to skip the project planning because for following reasons:

item.title: mclock - Additional clock application for mac menu bar
item.description: Update (2016-01-20): The app is now available on Mac App store. Additional menu clock for your Mac. A minimalist clock to display time of different timezone of your choice.

item.title: Idea to action: Tile this
item.description: Not many of my ideas are converted to a project, this one has seen its light last week. Though I haven’t completed all the UI and features of my original vision, it is better to have one working idea than nothing.

item.title: RIL2Insta - Import Read it Later links to Instapaper
item.description: One of my long time wish to write a Chrome extension completed last week. It all started when my answer was down-voted at apple.

item.title: Distribute your iPhone/iPad adhoc builds Over The Air using Dropbox
item.description: Update: I recently found this site called diawi.com which allows you to distribute the app similar to file-sharing sites, drag and drop ipa file and share the link to the testers.

item.title: Shell script to generate images for testing
item.description: Recently I was in need of generating sample images for no. of products in my db. I really hate to create a copy of image for each products in my db.

item.title: SVN: Export only updated files between 2 revisions
item.description: Are you someone like me who is looking for an SVN command that exports the files updated between two revisions?

item.title: Google Chrome : Hybrid of all
item.description: Webkit as rendering engine like Safari Tabstyles are from Flock Startup page similar to Opera speed-dial and Flock myhome page Paste and go in the address bar like Opera No menu bar like IE 7 Tab-to-window and vice versa from Opera/Safari Incognito browsing similar to Private Browsing Create Application Shortcuts like Mozilla Prism What’s new in Google Chrome No two separate textboxes for URL and for Search Every tab is a separate process Innovative Search, composite of Tortoise Merge (any Textdiff app), Firefox’s (Highlight All) findbox positioned similar to Safari Built-in support for Google Gears Above all its from the giant Google

item.title: SVN: Auto UPDATE WORKING COPY after COMMIT
item.description: In one of our recent project, we were looking for an automated script that update the working copy of our dev server as soon as someone commit the changes to the SVN.

item.title: Sticky notes with PHP and Jquery
item.description:
Script speaks louder than words. Please go through the following links PHP Gd based Sticky script
Jquery UI based Sticky page

item.title: Play YouTube with FLV player of your choice
item.description: Not working anymore, but you are free to explore the code. Updates are welcome. I have completed alternative way to view YouTube videos with FLV player of your choice (JW FLV player in this case).

item.title: Tamil.net links xTamil tool
item.description: I’m overwhelmed with happiness after I saw my Google analytics report today. This blog and the new tool which I wrote xTamil - English to Tamil convertor (Unicode) are linked in a Tamil portal site Tamil.

item.title: English to Tamil convertor (Unicode)
item.description: Atlast, I finished my first verison of English to Tamil unicode convertor(Transliterater). What I planned to do was bit different than the one which is available now.

item.title: Clean yahoo webmail without Ad's
item.description: Today, I have uploaded my second Greasemonkey scripts to userscripts, Yahoo webmail++ . This will remove (hide) the advertisements in your yahoo webmail, the one at the top and the small ads on the left side.

item.title: Safari for Windows
item.description: Finally Apple offers Safari for Windows, I am on my Safari now!. But there are bugs in Windows version of Safari, please go through the Techrunch link.

item.title: Why does my dreamweaver look so beautiful?
item.description: I don’t find an alternative title. Like anyone out there, I envy Textmate features where it is present in all the screencasts for PHP & RoR out there.
